Detailed Description

A logging service based on streams.

Any class may use LOG() macros to send log output to a predefined source, usually console or a file. Usage is as follows:

LOG(INFO) << "some text";

The possible log levels are: INFO, WARNING, ERROR and FATAL. One of those levels must always be provided. FATAL will exit the whole application. The logging here is inspired by the Google Logging Library "glog", but in a very simplified form.

The Logger class works by creating a new Logger object every time when LOG() is called. When the object is deleted, the actual writing takes place.
